fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • An article and its headline said fracking had been banned in the UK after a government U-turn (2 November, page 1). To clarify, and as expanded on in the article, a moratorium has been put in place that “‘will be maintained until compelling new evidence is provided’ that proves fracking could be safe”. This moratorium only applies in England because the issue is one on which policy is devolved. • Other recently corrected articles include: Telegraph issues correction over Boris Johnson’s false UK economy claim Lawyers argue Happy the elephant should have right to freedom Home Office decried for blocking NHS scheme to use more trainee doctors from overseas
